import React, { Component } from 'react'; import { Layout, Navigation, Content } from 'react-mdl'; import { Link } from 'react-router-dom'; import AdidasHack from './images/AdidasHack.jpg'; import AdidasAll from './images/AdidasAll.jpg'; import AdidasWin from './images/AdidasWin.jpg'; import TechAdidas1 from './images/TechAdidas1.png'; import TechAdidas2 from './images/TechAdidas2.png'; class Resume extends Component { render() { return(

Ucode by Adidas

(Mar 2018. Zaragoza, Spain.)

"A 36-hours hackathon to develop an IoT solution to bring new user experience to the Adidas customers."

Adidas wants to use the latest technology to bring a new experience to its customer and change the way the brand interacts with them. The 36-hours Ucode hackathon by Adidas aimed to engage students to participate in the development of innovative service experience using digital solutions. The challenge was to develop a functional digital solution for Adidas that uses IoT technology: Beacons, Bluetooth, Raspberry Pi, NFC ...

NED-team, a four students team from the Polytechnic University of Madrid participated together in the event and we won the challenge “1º place for the IoT solution”, we formed a balanced team with computer science backgrounds.

The problem

As a first step, we needed to define a problem to solve with our application. As time was limited to 36 hours, we had to move quickly and brainstormed problem statements and find the best solution to implement it.

We focused our design and development towards solving the challenge of bringing a new service to the customer. The first challenge we find that Adidas shops still have a very traditional way to sell their products. This situation makes people stop going to Adidas shops to buy and as a consequence, the customer buys more online. The goal of the team was to use IoT to bring a new concept of shelling products in physical shops and the user was able to try the products.

The solution

The solution we aimed to hack together was an Android mobile application called “Adidas Shop” that connect different devices to the same platform, creating a new store experience. To implement this final solution we made use of React Native, Android studio, IBM cloud, Firebase and Python for the software, and NFC, Bluetooth, Estimote and RaspberryPi as the IoT network.

The result within 36 hours was Adidas shop, an App that change the way user experience when they go to buy to an Adidas shop, let the user try their products and have all their data connection.

My learning

The Ucode by Adidas was my second real two “overnight” Hackathon. We learned that it is important to participate in a diverse team of developers and designers and also keep business aspects in mind. As a team, we worked according to our skills and took some time to plan the features and user journey before starting the actual “hacking”. My main role in the team was to manage the team organization, develop the idea, design the interface, develop the front-end and be the responsible to do the pitch. This also helped us come up with a better, more thought-through solution in the end. Our effort was recognised: Adidas Shop won the first prize for the IoT category.

Last but not least, I learned how important it is to believe in oneself as a team and keep going even if success seems far away. It may seem difficult to continue at 4:00 am when nothing is working out yet – but every team is going through the same struggle and in the end, the extra effort will be worth it.
